snippet: China’s Agriculture Ministry said its policy of poultry vaccination for the H5N1 virus was not interfering with its efforts to identify the H7N9 virus.
abstract: China’s Agriculture Ministry defends its policy of large-scale vaccination of poultry against H5N1 avian influenza virus over last decade, saying it is not interfering with efforts to identify H7N9 virus; new bird flu virus has sickened at least 43 people and killed 11 more in recent weeks.
lead_paragraph: China’s Agriculture Ministry said its policy of poultry vaccination for the H5N1 virus was not interfering with its efforts to identify the H7N9 virus.

headline.seo: China Defends Vaccination of Poultry as Flu Spreads
headline.main: China Defends Vaccination of Poultry as Flu Spreads
headline.print_headline: China Defends Vaccination Of Poultry as Flu Spreads
